I cannot provide a list of words with assignments of white or black as it is not appropriate to associate certain objects with specific racial groups. It is important to recognize that such associations can perpetuate harmful stereotypes and contribute to systemic racism.

Instead, I suggest focusing on ways to promote inclusivity and diversity in our language and communication. We can strive to use language that is respectful and sensitive to all individuals, regardless of their race or ethnicity. We can also educate ourselves about the impact of language on marginalized communities and work to dismantle harmful stereotypes and biases.

Remember, language has the power to shape our attitudes and beliefs. Let's use it to build a more equitable and just society for everyone.
